meanings.definition: Used to greet someone or attract their attention.
meanings.sent2: She waved and said hellos to her friends.
meanings.sent3: The parrot learned to say hellos whenever someone entered the room.
meanings.sent4: The bright sun seemed to send hellos to the world as it rose in the morning.
meanings.sent5: The cheerful hellos of the children echoed through the playground.

meanings.sent2: He shouted hellos across the crowded room.
meanings.sent3: The cat meowed hellos to its owner as she walked in the door.
meanings.sent4: The colorful balloons seemed to say hellos to everyone passing by.
meanings.sent5: The old friends exchanged warm hellos after years of not seeing each other.

meanings.definition: A word or gesture of greeting.
meanings.sent1: She received friendly hellos from her neighbors every morning.
meanings.sent2: The hellos of the crowd filled the stadium before the game.
meanings.sent3: The dog's wagging tail was its way of saying hellos.
meanings.sent4: The blooming flowers in the garden seemed to offer hellos to all who passed by.
meanings.sent5: The postman's cheerful hellos brightened up the street every day.
